output: Major League Cricket is owned by a variety of investors including high-profile individuals and companies. Notable owners include Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Adobe CEO Shantanu Narayen, and owners of IPL teams such as Mukesh Ambani, Shah Rukh Khan, and India Cements Ltd. The league has received an investment of around $850 million to establish and run the league, with the six teams expected to spend between $75 million to $100 million over the coming year.

This year's edition of the MLC features several notable changes and expansions compared to its inaugural season. Firstly, the number of matches has increased from 19 to 25, providing more opportunities for competition and entertainment. Additionally, the tournament has attracted high-profile Australian players such as Steve Smith, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head, enhancing the quality of play and the tournament's international appeal. The MLC has also been granted List A status by the ICC, which is a significant recognition of the tournament's quality and will allow players' performances to be officially recognized in their career statistics. Furthermore, the tournament schedule has been expanded to run from July 5 to July 28, and despite the same salary cap, top players can still earn $175,000 for a minimum of five games. Lastly, the tournament will be held in Dallas and Morrisville, North Carolina, with no games scheduled at the new modular stadium in New York.
In the tournament, a total of 25 sixes were scored by the batsmen. The team that scored the most sixes was MINY, with a total of 9 sixes.
No batsmen scored centuries based on the available data.

The teams that won matches played at Church Street Park ground are MI New York and Washington Freedom. Specifically, Washington Freedom won a match against MI New York at Church Street Park on July 6, 2024. There is no information provided about any matches won by MI New York at Church Street Park.
